isis.stitle: ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROL RELAY VALVE: BENDIX ATR-2 - DISASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: The following disassembly and assembly procedure is presented for reference purposes only. Instructions packaged with repair and maintenance kits should always be followed instead of the instructions presented here.

caution.para: The valve may be lightly clamped in a bench vise during disassembly, however, over-clamping will result in damage to the valve and result in leakage and/or malfunction. If a vise is to be used, position the valve so that the jaws bear on the supply ports on opposing sides of the valve body.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove all air fittings and plugs from the valve.

Mark the relationship of the valve cover (Item 2) to the body (Item 1) and, if the valve is equipped with a mounting bracket (Item 41), mark the relationship of the bracket to the cover and body (Item 1).
Mark the relationship of the electronic controller (Item 39) to the cover (Item 2).
While holding the exhaust cover (Item 4), remove the retaining ring (Item 3) that secures it to the body (Item 1).
Remove the exhaust cover (Item 4) along with both O-rings (Items 5 and 6).
Remove the valve spring (Item 7), valve retainer (Item 8), and the valve assembly (Item 9) from the body (Item 1).
Remove and retain the four capscrews (Item 38) that secure the electronic controller (Item 39) to the cover (Item 2), then separate and retain the controller (Item 39) from the cover (Item 2).
Remove and retain the two long capscrews (Item 10) and nuts (Item 43) that secure the cover (Item 2) to the body (Item 1).
Remove and retain the two capscrews and lockwashers (Item 42) that secure the bracket (Item 41) to the cover (Item 2), then remove and retain the bracket.
Remove and retain the two short capscrews (Item 40) that secure the cover (Item 2) to the body (Item 1).
Separate the cover (Item 2) from the body (Item 1), then remove the sealing ring (Item 35) and O-ring (Item 11).
Remove the relay piston (Item 12) and relay piston spring (Item 14) from the body (Item 1).

note.para: The relay piston spring, Item 14, is not used in all valves.

step1.para: Remove the O-ring (Item 13) from the relay piston (Item 12).
Remove the retaining ring (Item 15). Then remove check valve seat (Item 16), with O-rings (Items 20 and 21). Remove O-rings (Items 20 and 21) from check valve seat.
Remove the check valve (Item 17), guide (Item 18), and spring (Item 19).
Remove the inlet seat (Item 36) with O-rings (Items 37 and 44), then remove and discard O-rings (Items 37 and 44) from the inlet seat (Item 36).
Remove the spring (Item 22), then remove and retain the spring cage (Item 23) from the valve cover (Item 2).
Use shop air at the control port to extract the blend back piston (Item 24) from the valve cover (Item 2). Retain the piston (Item 24), but remove and discard both O-rings (Items 25 and 26).
Remove the entire assembled proportioning piston (Item 28) from the valve cover (Item 2). Then remove and discard O-rings (Items 27 and 29).
Remove retaining ring (Item 30). Remove inlet seat (Item 32) then remove and discard inlet valve (Item 33) and spring (Item 34). Remove and discard O-ring (Item 31) from the inlet seat (Item 32).
